website_summaries.verdict: In spite of some irritating quirks, KEEN Seacamps are worth considering for kids who enjoy outdoor activities in warm weather and climates.
pros: A great pick for summertime wear thanks to the airy sandal construction which is made of flexible, washable polyester with tough rubber soles
Comes in cute styles for both boys and girls, from toddlers to pre-teens
cons: Some parents found that they run somewhat wide
The Velcro closure has been known to come unfastened, especially when on active kids' feet

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Newport
customer_reviews.text: We really like putting our kids in Keen sandals because they're so durable and easy to clean. Previously we were getting them the Keen Newport sandals, but the Seacamp ones were on sale, so we went with those this time. I like them a lot better. The sole is slightly slimmer and more flexible, and my toddler seemed to have a much easier time running in them. Unless the Newports are significantly cheaper, I would go with the Seacamps. I would add though that both sandals are a bit narrow in the toddler sizes. We always have to go up a size for my son, and he always outgrows the width before he fills out the shoe lengthwise.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy KB

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up to expectations from past keen purchases
customer_reviews.text: We've been buying my daughter Keens since she was 2. They've always held up well to hiking, swimming, the beach and such and were in good condition once she outgrown them. This last pair we bought on here in 2014 have not held up well at all. In fact anytime they get wet they dye my daughter's feet red. Disappointed in buying a more expensive product that isn't holding up to past expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley N Moorhouse

customer_reviews.title: Everything as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought size 6 for my 22 month old. Her other shoes are Pediped (Baby Originals, size 18-24 months). (I believe the size 5 for Keen corresponded to her exact foot size so I got a size above so it will fit for the entire summer). I got these because of the closed back and front, the ability to go in water, and the thin sole compared to the other Keen sandal. PROs: Fits as expected. Flexible sole, I can bend it easily with one hand and also twist it. Easy to put on. Even though I got a size up, they are not too loose. CONs: 4 stars because I don't like the big price discrepancy between colors! :)
customer_reviews.author: Karolyn

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than Newport H2's. Big Kid 6 = 7.5 Women's.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of Keen sandals. I am a full-grown woman that fits the Keen's Big Kid size 6 (I wear 7.5 Women's). My first pair (Newport H2) has been tried-and-true, traveling to several countries for miles of hikes and walks through all sorts of terrain and weather. I wanted a 2nd pair to wear while my 1st pair was drying from rain/rafting/beach. These are comparable to the Newport H2's in that both are comfortable, air-dry pretty fast and are the ugliest shoes I own. The main difference is that these are much lighter and nowhere near as clunky and clowny-looking. You won't win any fashion contests with these but they are practical and excellent hiking sandals.
customer_reviews.author: BobannyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: SECOND YEAR BUYING THESE, BEST WATER SHOES!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these last year for my 2 y/o, bought them again this year. They are just the best hybrid shoes. They support like a sneaker, but breath like a sandal. They are no skid and are super comfy. They dry pretty quickly and look pretty much new even at the end of the season. My daughter has a wider food where her toes are and these are comfortable for her. Will most definitely be buying another pair again for next summer. Great water/hiking/ summer shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but runs small
customer_reviews.text: These were very nice looking shoes for my granddaughter, but they run smaller than the other Keen shoes we ordered. I ordered 3 different Keen styles in toddler size 5, Whisper, Seacamp II and Newport H2-T. The Whispers were the longest, least square-toed (come out to a very slight point). The Seacamps were the shortest, noticeably smaller than the Whispers. Newports were a more in-between length and were the ones that fit the best.
customer_reviews.author: LandS

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, cute, and seemingly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: We like to have a pair or two of shoes that are quick and easy to put on for when to kids think they need to be outside immediately. The shoes we were using were causing rub sore/blisters on both kids. We decided to try these and they have been fantastic, especially for our 3 y/o. He can put them on himself and they don’t seem to cause an irritation. They’re cute and sturdy enough that they can scooter or bike around in them safely. We have really loved them so far.
customer_reviews.author: swifty

customer_reviews.title: Stank so bad!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought Keen sandals each summer for my kids. This pair has been a huge disappointment. After barely 3 wears the shoes took on the worst stink. Kids at school bullied my kid over the smell. I've washed them in the washer. I've tried scrubbing the inside with a toothbrush and baking soda. I've put deodorant on my kids feet before putting on freshly washed shoes. Nothing works thru 1 day of wear. I don't have time to wash the shoes daily. The functional design and color is great but because of the stink these shoes are getting donated and I'm buying Chacos instead. Don't waste your money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, hard to get on and off
customer_reviews.text: (Review by wife) These are good quality shoes but my 2 year old didn’t like them. She’s picky about shoes though so that doesn’t necessarily mean there was anything uncomfortable about them. But as a mom, they’re really hard to get on and off... I need Velcro in my kids shoes! We ended up returning.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Maurer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a very active 3 yr old!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Seacamps for my very active 3 yr old grandson. He won’t wear flip flops for more than 5 minutes because he hates the strap between his toes. Also he can’t run in them. I decided to give these a try. It’s too hot here in California to wear a tennis shoe if you don’t have to. These were a huge hit with him as well as his parents. They are very sturdy and he can run, hop, walk in water and still protect his feet. They are easy to get on and off. I know they are pricey but you do get what you pay for. He loves these.
customer_reviews.author: J. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sandals for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: My almost 3 year old who often refuses to try on new shoes (especially sandals), tried these on, and really loves them. I put them on over socks initially, and, on a hot day, took socks off - baby loved it both ways (with and without socks), was actively jumping, running on a beach and outdoor play-yard - perfect solution for summer! very happy so far, she did not even mind sand gets in, very easy to take on/off.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs on the large/wide side otherwise great!
customer_reviews.text: Had to return due to the fit being too large and very wide. We are sizing down but haven't received the smaller size yet to update on the fit and function. Update: We received the smaller size and it fits great. My 2 year old loves her new shoes. They are nice and flexible which is important for me in kids' shoes. I'd say they run about a half size bigger than Stride Rite shoes we have in the same size.
customer_reviews.author: A. Byer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This was our second summer using Keens and I won't be going back for a third. The velcro began coming detached from the strap about a month after buying them. I also purchased these since they're washable but it didn't help much with dirt or smell. If I had to list only 1 reason I wouldn't buy them again though, it would be because of the smell. My son's feet smelled *AWFUL* after wearing these and continued to smell worse as time went on. Again, I washed them and it did nothing to the odor. We don't have this issue in any other shoes that he wears so I definitely blame his Keens. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: TheIrishSmile

customer_reviews.title: Love the brand, glad I ordered a size up for toddler
customer_reviews.text: Glad I ordered a size up! The little guy is currently in size 8 toddler converses, but ordered the size 9 toddler keens. They fit great! He does have a long narrow foot, so these have a little more width than he really needs, but they stay on great and his toe is at the perfect spot to fit well now and have room to grow a little more this summer. Love the reliability of how keens hold up, and hope these hold true to the standard!
customer_reviews.author: Betsy G

customer_reviews.title: Size Down!
customer_reviews.text: My family lives in keens in the summer, although my kids find them cumbersome unless they are creeping or hiking. They prefer flipflops for slipping on and going outside the house. My son wears a men’s 8 in most shoes and I was dreading having to purchase men’s keens for him since the price jump is considerable. I ordered a pair of these in kids 7 and they fit! My other son also wears a size down in keen sandals. I ended up returning these because he prefers the Newport H2. He says they are sturdier and protect his feet better with the heavier sole.
customer_reviews.author: C. Teleki

customer_reviews.title: Keens + Toddlers = Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: I know the price is a little high for toddler shoes, but for each age group, we buy our son one pair of keens and one pair of vans. Between those two, he doesn't need any other shoes for the year. These hold up well for learning to walk, hiking, playing in the mud (washable people!), swimming/lakes/etc, YOU NAME IT! My son is HARD on shoes and before we started the two brand plan, we were buying a new pair of shoes at Target or Walmart every month. These are worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne

customer_reviews.title: Good summer sandal
customer_reviews.text: I was lucky to find in my size. A good value plus, I love the color blue. Keens doesn't offer this in women's shoes. I have a wide foot and narrow heal. This sandal is tough, offers good support, protects my toes while bike riding, keeps small rocks and debris out for the most part when walking/hiking on trails. Easy to wash and air drys fast. Soft too. I didn't get any blisters all summer long and these sandals were used regularly all summer.
customer_reviews.author: H20fall

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandal, a little tight
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good sandals and cute on;, I deducted a star because they run a bit small and they are a little challenging to get on. I have to really pull them on my 3 year old's foot with the back tab - he cannot do it himself which is a bummer for a busy mom of 3 kids 5 and under. They are much thinner and more flexible than traditional Keen sandals which I love - I think it's better for a kid foot. Once they are on, they are comfortable and have been since first wear. My son have wide and thick feet so these would probably work even better for a kiddo with thin feet.
customer_reviews.author: H.A.E.

customer_reviews.title: Super impressed with Keen shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love KEEN shoes! Yes, they are pricey, but the other sandal or fast dry shoes do not compare. I have tried several other brands for my 4 kids and will only buy KEENs from now on. They wear them on hikes, water parks, and theme parks, which require miles of walking and usually get wet. My kids have worn them for the past several years and none have gotten a blister. They dry faster than other similar shoes and they don't smell.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler shoes for the summer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my 20 months old daughter. She's got wide feet and many shoes don't feet her well. This pair fits great and she seems to like it! She immediately put them on and went outside to play. I haven't noticed any blisters on her feet or any redness anywhere. The only thing that didn't impress me is the Velcro fastening around the ankle. It seems to be a little loose and doesn't have long enough velcro strip to tighten it properly on her thin ankles. However, I haven't noticed that she would have problems walking because of it. Overall, great shoes! Recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: ykh

customer_reviews.title: Great for this Missionary
customer_reviews.text: I am in Vanautu on an LDS Charities mission assigned to do humanitarian work. We were advised before we left to get KEEN sandals. It was the best advice. They go through water, hiking, muddy trails into villages, through town and into business meetings and keep looking great. Excellent value for the money. I am a lady but with a wide foot and I purchased a child's shoe for a perfect fit. Take a look at this picture, I have my KEENs on. Wear them walking to church.
customer_reviews.author: Cubby

customer_reviews.title: great for summer
customer_reviews.text: I buy my kids a pair of these close toe sandals every spring. I love the closed toe so their toes are protected as they play. we are hard on our shoes and these hold up extremely well. They are washable, durable, and my girls say they are comfortable. When its cool out we wear them with socks and you can hardly tell it doesnt' look weird.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Not orange!
customer_reviews.text: So the picture shows orange but after going back in it says purple. Id call it more a dark pink. These are for a little boy but luckily he loves pink! I'll update after he wears them a bit. Update - tried them on and they do fit well. My son doesn't want to wear them but he just got a pair of dinosaur water shoes so those are his current favorites.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Bought for both kids
customer_reviews.text: Since I love the adult version of this sanke, nice and light, better than the other versions of keens that are too bulky. Also seem to fit my children very well serves purpose I can definitely recommend. I like that there’s no issues getting them wet or dirty as kids should be free to play. Good foot protection . Somewhat expensive i try to buy out of season
customer_reviews.author: Ava K Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent summer shoe for toddler
customer_reviews.text: I bought the pink sandals in toddler size 7 for my 2.5 year old daughter, and I am very impressed with the quality. They are lightweight, they have traction on the bottom, and they are soft on the inside (meaning no blisters so far). These will be great summer shoes that can be worn at daycare (toe guard and closed heel), and it appears that no socks are needed either. I would definitely recommend these shoes to anyone with an active toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Glow81

customer_reviews.title: Great for tiny puddle splashers
customer_reviews.text: We got these for our little puddle stomper and she wears them a LOT. She was wearing a 4.5 in stride rite and still had a little room to grow, but there aren't half sizes for this shoe so I ordered up. They are a bit long on her but she's a good enough walker/runner that it doesn't affect her much. They are easy to put on, but watch that toes don't get stuck in the gaps. Love that no socks are needed and she can get them wet. These are basically the only shoes she wears now. Never any blisters or red marks. These would be a bit hard to walk in for a first time walker.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Fairbanks

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, sturdy sandals
customer_reviews.text: My daughter says that these sandals are comfortable, and they have held up to a lot of play. My daughter's feet are slightly wide, and these shoes are roomy enough to accommodate socks. We purchased these in red, and enjoy the nice range of colors of this brand. I would recommend these shoes, and will buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, comfortable, well-made.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are the best. Keens last forever -- so well made and great materials. And these have the "CNX" sole, which is a little less thick and bulky vs. the traditional sole on the Newports but they still have a nice sturdy sole that provides good support and protection. My 5-yr old son uses these as his everyday shoe and they've held up great. One pair can last a whole season until he outgrows them and moves up a size. We're on pair number 2 for both kids.
customer_reviews.author: arbequina

customer_reviews.title: but these are great even though they are technically not a wide sandal
customer_reviews.text: We struggled to find a pair of wide width sandals for our almost 2 year old, but these are great even though they are technically not a wide sandal. They seem like they'll wash up well, and so far, no blisters from wearing them new without socks. Be careful when putting little feet into them - if they spread their toes, they might get hooked on one of the open spots. Very happy with the purchase, though!
customer_reviews.author: Smithson

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to put on
customer_reviews.text: I love these sandals. They're cute, well made, and they fit great! But my 5 year old seldom wears them because he finds them difficult to put on with the way the Velcro attaches. I don't know why it's not simpler. Too bad. They were too expensive for only once in a while wear and probably won't fit him anymore next year.
customer_reviews.author: Viv

customer_reviews.title: Hands Down Best Sandals for Adventurous Kids
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of Keen sandals I've bought for my son. THEY ARE FANTASTIC!!! He wore them everyday hiking through Australia for 3 weeks, and we walked a lot! Perfect for hot sand beach, and waterproof as well! They were brand new and he didn't get one blister or complain about them hurting his feet. Keen sandals last forever and are so comfortable. I have a pair myself and wear them all summer long. Definitely worth the price, especially if you can pass them on, because they are almost indestructible.
customer_reviews.author: ma kuns mama

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for active kids
customer_reviews.text: I buy these for my kids every year. They wear them every day in the summer! They do get a bit smelly but they wash well. These are perfect for active kids and protect little feet from injury (aside from the occasional stick that finds its way into the hole on the side). Fit as expected. For half size, I’d go up unless they are just barely into the half size.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne E. Gaddis

customer_reviews.title: We had purchased the Seacamp sandals two years back for ...
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased the Seacamp sandals two years back for our son and he has been wearing them non-stop. Non of the other KEEN styles has the same combination of heel to toe drop and traction that these sandals have. We have tried on and/or purchased and returned several pairs of replacements - until we found these online. Ordered the next size up and it fits perfectly. Fabric is strong but still soft and the color was accurate.
customer_reviews.author: SamTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Great little shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my three year old granddaughter. She likes them because she can put them on and take them off "all by herself." Her mother likes them because they can be worn without socks and not rub tender little feet. Also, they can be thrown in the washing machine and come out almost dry. We didn't have any issue with straps; to tell the truth we never pull the straps all the way out, just loosen them to get the shoe off and tighten to put them on.
customer_reviews.author: What4

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I really like Keen products, and have ordered them before on Amazon. Both my sons, my wife and I all have Keen sandals, so I was excited to buy another pair. Unfortunately, this product by Keen is very narrow and my son could not get his foot inside. Comparing this product side by side with his other Keen sandals, you can see a huge difference in width. If you child has a wide foot, don't get this Keen product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Matracia

customer_reviews.title: bought another pair
customer_reviews.text: i bought this item in a different size. my toddler grow out of it. but it like this item so much that i bought the same item size up. toddler loves it too. slip on and off easily and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: MvP

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sandals! Years of purchases!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these sandals every summer for the last 4 years. They hold up great all summer long. This year, since my son is 5, I decided to let him choose between these or the Newports. He chose Seacamp, said they were lighter and more flexible. We love these and will continue to buy them every summer for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Corie

customer_reviews.title: ... got these for my 15 month old and we love them. She can wear them in the water
customer_reviews.text: We got these for my 15 month old and we love them. She can wear them in the water, to daycare, out walking, in the house--anywhere. They do start to smell though, but I wonder if it is just my little girl's stinky feet (she gets it from her dad!). I do not think they have arch support, but I am not the one wearing them. She loves them though and is very comfortable in them. We just wash them when they smell and they hold up wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ferri

customer_reviews.title: Great sandal though pricey$$
customer_reviews.text: These have been my son’s favorite close-toe sandal for many years now. Every year he loves picking out a new color... yes they are pricy for a kids sandal but they last and wash well. Sometimes you can find these in Nord Rack or Marshalls for little less $ but they really are great for kids who are rough on their shoes
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Pricey for the material
customer_reviews.text: Its already worn out and my daughter is not someone who jumps crazy at all. Velcro doesn’t stay intact. I thought it would last at least for 6 months. Disappointed with the money charged. I would not pay more than $12 for this item.
customer_reviews.author: Dimple Agarwal

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless you love funky feet smell!
customer_reviews.text: These sandals make my son's feet smell as if something died. Only after a week of wearing them, they stink an entire room up after he takes them off. I've washed them, but the smell comes right back. He's worn other sandals without this smell, so it's not him. They are comfortable shoes for him, but we just can't get past the smell.
customer_reviews.author: J Hughes

customer_reviews.title: HUGE
customer_reviews.text: Returning them because they are huge. They only come in half sizes. My toddler uses a 10.5 so I ordered an 11 thinking I shouldn't order something with a number smaller than what all his other shoes say. The shoes showed up and my babies heart almost exploded at the site of hid new "batman sandals" that he had been waiting for...... They are like clown shoes. Fine. I didn't know how to order and there is nothing in the description that tells you how to select the correct size. I went to order a new pair and the price went up $20 over night! What in the world?
customer_reviews.author: Kdekreon

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for outdoor beginner walker
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 11month old son who wants to explore outside. They don’t fall off, but are easy to put on. The soles are true keens in comfort and they hold up to mud and water no problem. We bought the next size up already because I can tell these are going to be a staple in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Barnard

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sandal with slight problem.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality sandal. Purchased for a 11 year old growing boy a size larger. The fit is good, however, the ankle top strap Velcro is not long enough for a strong attachment. A little more Velcro would have be better. It center pull string takes care of the problem and his ankle will get fatter over time.
customer_reviews.author: CAL

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes but keep in mind they aren't for a wide foot
customer_reviews.text: Firstly I do love these, they are very cute and in my opinion more visually appealing than previous keens. That being said, I bought them for my son who has a semi wide foot bed and these didn't fit him well at all so I had him trade sandals with his brother who I found and older style for which is wider. My son has been wearing them for awhile now and they still look brand new. Keens are pricey but you can't go wrong with this brand as far as durability. I bought my boys merells last year and while I wasn't completely disappointed with them I didn't love them as much as keens.
customer_reviews.author: RS Reviews

customer_reviews.title: and I love that I can throw them in the wash or ...
customer_reviews.text: A lightweight alternative to the Newports. Our toddler loves these, and I love that I can throw them in the wash or hose them off and they're good as new after a few hours in the sun (also kills the stink). He is between a size 5 and a size 6; I bought both, and the 5 was clearly the winner for now. By summer he'll be in the six, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Q

customer_reviews.title: One pair is worth replacing 3 or 4! Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are worth the money when you think about how many other pairs of shoes get ruined in the summer by those irresistible puddles and muddy places! I bought a size up and that was fine as the closure secured well. Washed them many time and have never had any problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: E. A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for wide food/cankle!
customer_reviews.text: 14 mo old has wide feet and a thick ankle. ;) I tried numerous stride rite sandals in wide. Too tight and she tried to rip them all off. She loves these! She’s a 4 and I got a 5. Seems perfect to wear now and still grow into for summer. So happy with purchase. Also, will be great shoes for water table play time!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: I must warn you to order a size down because they run pretty large. The color is as shown and surprisingly ...
customer_reviews.text: This shoe never disappoints! I must warn you to order a size down because they run pretty large. The color is as shown and surprisingly it goes with everything even if it isn't that color it still looks good. This shoe is durable, it last longer than they can wear them, and they can get wet with no stinky problems. I am buying them for all of my children. We love them!
customer_reviews.author: D. P.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for kids.
customer_reviews.text: Keen sandals have been a year-round stable for kids for 10 years. The awesome benefit of CNX shoes are a more flexible sole allowing a better opportunity for grip around water and over and rocks for climbing and hiking. Small down side (or upside) - CNX sandals and shoes seem to run a 1/2 size smaller than other Keens (based on the 7-8 pairs that we’ve had so far).
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these Keens
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were a little smaller than I expected, so I returned and got the next size up. Now, they are perfect and we have already put them to the test through mud, water, scooters, running and everything in between. No more arguments about socks. It is exactly what we need for this spring/summer! Worth a little extra money for quality I can count on.
customer_reviews.author: katiejomcd

customer_reviews.title: Streamlined Sandal that is great for everyday wear
customer_reviews.text: We went down a whole size in these shoes but it was well worth the back and forth shipping. My daughter wears these as her everyday shoes all summer and says they are very comfortable. They are easy for her to get on and they are not as bulky as some of the other Keen styles, Merrells or Kamiks. Even with all of the wear, 2 months in they still look great. The velcro is holding up well and I will definitely be purchasing more of these for future sizes.
customer_reviews.author: GraceMorgn

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly poor quality, especially for this price
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my 7 year old and the lace on one of them broke on day 2 of wearing them. It's impossible to thread back through the soft, floppy, narrow canvas loops. Luckily, it doesn't seem to be necessary, just decorative. UPDATE: Two weeks later, these are absolutely falling apart. The day after I wrote the above review, the other lace broke. Within two weeks, the stitching that holds the Velcro onto the straps was pulling out on both shoes, and the Velcro already had that "fluffy" look it gets when it's falling apart. I returned them for a refund and will not buy Keens again.
customer_reviews.author: mylocat

customer_reviews.title: Adorable but not for chunky feet
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my 2 year old daughter because I wear Keen work boots and they are amazingly comfortable. When I put them on her I was delighted with how well they seemed to fit and they were so cute, I started shopping for a pair of Keen saddles for myself! However, after she wore them about 2 hours there was a spot on her foot that had been rubbed raw. So I am regretfully returning these because they are apparently a tad too narrow for my girl.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Great water shoe that will also keep his toes safe ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price for an active 3yo. We go on weekly nature hikes and park playdates and these were exactly what we needed. Great water shoe that will also keep his toes safe when he tries to climb things. Washes well and air dries overnight and is ready to use the next day. I'm sure his feet with outgrow these before they wear down.
customer_reviews.author: Vu Family

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for a high price
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money at all. My daughter has had these for a month and already the tab on the strap has come off and the laces have snapped, so I don’t think she can wear them anymore. Neither defect would be covered by their “warranty” (which after reading it, I’m honestly not sure what would be). She’s 4/almost 5 but somewhat hard on shoes but we typically get at least 6 months out of tennis shoes and we’ve made it full summers with Keens previously. We used to swear by Keens, but I don’t think the quality is what it used to be. I’m not likely to buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: These are good
customer_reviews.text: These sandals are good for couple of hours of playing at the park etc. They are NOT for playing outside with water playing/water parks etc. My son slips on these all the time when the floor is wet and running. They have good grip but just not for water. One thing i dont like is how the strap is kinda thin ...but overall they are ok.
customer_reviews.author: Analyzethis?

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, it stinks too much and gave bad odor to my daughters feet.
customer_reviews.text: I loved, how comfortable it was for my daughter, but ohh boy it stinks so bad, it literally made my daughters feet stink so much, doesn’t matter how many times I wash it. Very disappointed. Would’ve bought it if I knew about this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bhahn

customer_reviews.title: My 7 year old son fits these perfectly. I ...
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old son fits these perfectly. I was worried that he'd be "too old" for this keen look but they suit him well and he walked two days at Disney in them with no complaints. They are pricey but a very versatile shoe so they will be worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Christy M.

customer_reviews.title: My son has had these shoes every year since he ...
customer_reviews.text: My son has had these shoes every year since he learned to walk. This is the first year with the new strap that doubles back. I much prefer the once over Velcro strap as it was much easier for him to get on and off. With the older style sometimes the strap would come undone and I image that’s why they changed the design to double back so the shoe stays on even if it comes unvelcroed. We will continue to buy these shoes each year for each kid.
customer_reviews.author: Justin and Alison

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have these
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! As an adult I love my keens! Comfortable, great for hiking; good grip, no stubbing your toe! Can get wet...love these shoes! I thought the price was a little much for my 4 year old...but these shoes wear well! Great for camping, hiking, day at the beach, exploring, for any day really! I will probably splurge on a new pair every year. Great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Works for my son
customer_reviews.text: My son is 7 years old and wanted a pair of sneakers "with holes in the sides" like his friend has. I wanted to not be washing socks so much in the summer. He has worn these sandals everyday for about two months and they are holding up well. Great for playgrounds, tree climbing, hiking trails, and the day to day stuff of childhood.
customer_reviews.author: A. Soria

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for river shoes
customer_reviews.text: These seem to run small and the matter of getting them off and back on a 3 year old's feet becomes more difficult when they are wet. While the idea of these shoes as river shoes seems good, the fact is that small river pebbles and grit get in but don't wash out as easily as would be the case with sandals. This has been the case with Keen shoes for myself, my wife and our son. They are fine for warm weather, dry play.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin D Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy sandals, a bit tight width wise
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my daughter for an everyday use (not necessarily for trips including water). I measured the desired size based on the foot length and in that regard, they fir well. Even though I've bough 25/26 while my daughter is 24. Width-wise, the sandals kind of feel too tight (even though they're a size above my daughter's feet size). Beside that, they're durable and look awesome! Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Boltax Alexey

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler shoe.
customer_reviews.text: My son had been given these shoes for a present last year. He loved them so much that we ordered him the same shoe (different color) when he out grew that pair. After a year of wear, the last pair still function like new. The adjustable strap in the middle allowed us to tighten/loosen the shoe width as he grew and the closed toe/slip proof bottom makes them great for all weather conditions.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Cute Pink KEENS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My family loves KEEN shoes. We all have a pair, so I was thrilled to find a pink pair for my daughter. I wish they made this color pink in women's sizes. Very durable, easy for my daughter to get on and off all by herself. We loved them so much that I bought a pair in the next size up, ready for her when she outgrows these.
customer_reviews.author: TuB

customer_reviews.title: Every kid needs Keens!
customer_reviews.text: My son and daughter got their first pair of keens at age 2. It's been a few years since we've gotten them another pair because we thought of Keens being a pricey pair of "sandals." For a recent trip to Hawaii we bought each a pair and now wish we have buying these every year! Both kids wear them constantly. Easy to put on. Easy to clean. After three months of constant use they still look neW after a good washing! . They don't get smelly. For kids that love to play outside these are a must over flip flops, sandals, etc. Toes and heels are protected. Just fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Tobey C.

customer_reviews.title: Well Made - Protects Toes - Great for Water or Everyday - Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes for toddlers!! They fit as expected and the closed/protected toe is perfect for young kids. They clean very easily and are super easy to get on and off. The velcro hold very well and they are great for playing in the water (sprinklers, splash pad, beach/pool) and out of the water (park, walks, bikes, every-day). They are very well made and very comfortable. My daughter complains when shoes are not comfortable and she never complains about these. She always wants to wear them. I would highly recommend these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Cortney

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I love the keen sandals! They are great for kids because they're easy to put on and take off, come and cute colors. I love the fact that the enclosed toe helps protect they toes. The best part is that they are machine washable. I have a son with some leg issues and his doctor recommend only buying keen sandals for him. He says they are the best sandals for kids feet .
customer_reviews.author: lmag

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist, flexible design is great improvement!
customer_reviews.text: We have bought the kids Newports in the past, but the Seacamp has a much thinner, flexible sole and dries out faster than the Newport. My son has worn them all summer in creeks and on pavement with little to no wear apparent. He tears through cheaper brands of hiking shoes in a few months. I hope to see more of these more minimalist and low heel drop shoes from the Keen line!
customer_reviews.author: LJH

customer_reviews.title: who squealed with delight when she opened the box and had to wear ...
customer_reviews.text: These were for my granddaughter, who squealed with delight when she opened the box and had to wear them immediately. I bought them big, so they will hopefully last her next summer. However she almost fits into them now, so for a size 10, they aren't a very big 10 according to my daughter. However, my granddaughter is a very happy camper and that's the main thing. If I were ordering them again I would order an 11.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B.

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: They look adorable, fit great and baby keeps them on, but color is coming off after the first wear. I got them on sale so I don't want to return them. Wish I could exchange them for the same pair. Anyone know how to contact their customer service?
customer_reviews.author: Chicco

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: My son is on his second pair only reason we bought new ones was because he outgrew them. I have two boys and I handed down one pair to the other they looked almost new even though they had been worn as his brothers primary shoes. I love these shoes. Easy to clean never stinky, never ripped. A part from a strap adjuster broke off at some point but it didnt affect the shoe so im putting that in the plus category. You can adjust the width of the shoe so that helped as they were passed around between my two going from wide to medium.
customer_reviews.author: Momma2boyz

customer_reviews.title: Quiver of One
customer_reviews.text: These are the best keens my kid has had. They are lighter, more flexible, and have a thinner sole than his other keen sandals. I highly recommend these, he wore them in the jungle, walking down a river, on the beach and walking downtown and they worked perfect in all settings.
customer_reviews.author: Lucca B.

customer_reviews.title: Best sandals
customer_reviews.text: My son wore a pair of these all last summer to daycare and they were washed almost nightly after being subjected to the sandbox all day. He also had a pair just for home use. Both pairs held up nicely all summer, with the daycare pair being absolutely destroyed by September and the home pair still looking great. I plan to buy two more pairs this coming summer as the system worked out great! My soon to be 4 year old loves them. They are flexible and comfortable with a good amount of protection.
customer_reviews.author: FatOrangeTabby

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for playing or the water
customer_reviews.text: We buy these sandals in the same color every year for my son. They are great for playing and for it the water. They do take a little while to dry so if that's a problem I would buy a shoe with material like in Crocs. I've even washed them in the washing machine!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: and I've been happy with the way her feet have responded
customer_reviews.text: I bought myself a pair of Keen's for my pregnancy, and also wanted something supportive for my 2.5 year old who normally wears orthotics in her gym shoes. That being said, when it's 95 degrees out in the summer and she's playing in the yard, or she comes out of the pool, that's not always realistic. I needed something that would help support her for those rare times she is not wearing her gym shoes, and after doing a lot of research, purchased these, and I've been happy with the way her feet have responded! They seem very well made, and if you're open on color, you can probably get them cheaper here than anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my 9-year-old son back in March for our spring vacation to Hawaii. He has worn them often and they have been sturdy and durable and outlasted many other sneakers and sandals from stores like Target or Costco. They still look great and haven't faded and are going strong through the summer. My son wears hard on shoes and they usually fall apart before he outgrows them but I suspect he will outgrow these before they break down. Very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: The reviews on this product are great and I will continue the trend. Right out of the box, these KEEN sandals are comfortable for my son who is crazy-active. He can wear these all day and I have not found him in any discomfort. No blisters. No hotspots. They're pricey, but completely worth the money I spent. He will outgrow them before he wears them out - that cannot be said for all shoes. I am sold on this brand and will continue buying this product. You cannot go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: T. Vegs

customer_reviews.title: Love these sandals.
customer_reviews.text: Just got these in the mail today. Put them on my 16m old who just started walking last month. He immediately got up and took off. I thought he'd walk funny in them since they are his first real shoe but he is walking like he'd been walking in them forever. They are a little snug (but not bad) so if you kid has a bit wider foot or fat foot then I suggest the "wide" size. True to size! In fact I had him try on Stride Rite sneaker the other day size 5 and I ordered these in size 5 and they fit perfect. Going to be getting my 3yr old a pair too.
customer_reviews.author: Earbuds

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very nice but unfortunately I had to return them because they were too small for my daughter. I would definitely order the next size up. I had to return my pair and sons pair as well for the same aforementioned reason. My husband ordered from the company directly and was disappointed when his did not fit. We plan on reordering with the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Blessedmomof3

customer_reviews.title: I have bought these shoes twice
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these I have purchased. I bought them in a size 4 and as time went on this summer my daughter grew into the size 5. Well made durable shoes. I have thrown them in the machine several times and they come out like new. I am most likely going to stick with brand for her next pair. I will say my daughter is on the small side so they fit perfect. Most stores don't sell sandals in her size. I priced these out at a local popular shoe store and they wanted almost $60 for these
customer_reviews.author: christina

customer_reviews.title: Long-Term Customer Right Here!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the green Keen's and my son loves them! I was worried about the reviews where people had issues where their child's foot was getting blistered, but we have not encountered this issue. My son has been wearing them almost all summer long. He want to a very active camp during the summer and they held up perfectly. He now wears them to Kindergarten about every day. These are super easy to clean, and if you are an active family like us (playing, hiking, all over the place), then these are perfect for your little ones!
customer_reviews.author: Ericalc

customer_reviews.title: The best water shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best water/turf shoe on the market. Loved this one for my toddler as it wasn't as bulky as the other styles. She wore these all summer with all kinds of clothing and through quite a few theme parks. They go from water parks to hikes quite seamlessly. will purchase these every summer.
customer_reviews.author: Surrey Laine

customer_reviews.title: My 6yo is happy with his new kicks!
customer_reviews.text: Got this in a size 10T for my 6yo for an island trip and it was great! He has small feet, slightly narrow, and we purposely purchased these to be slightly big on him and it fit the bill. He wanted to wear it immediately after opening the box. He says it's very comfortable, even if it was a bit big. It's only April now and this should last him well into the beginning of the coming school year. I would say that these may be a tad tight for kids with wide feet, but comfortable for average/narrower feet.
customer_reviews.author: chunxMcG

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sturdy Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and the quality of the shoes. Fit my 2 yrs old son good and looks great. Feels very sturdy. The main reason i got these is that its easy to go in and out of water and they dry fast. My son constantly is in or around water so it was essential for us to have shoes that dry fast and won't get ruined.
customer_reviews.author: Irina Kutseva

customer_reviews.title: Great Sandals!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! This style of Keens are best for kids with narrower feet. My son wears a normal shoe size (not narrow) in other shoes but this style fits him much better than the other keen sandals because his feet are on the narrow side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great durable shoe and smelly feet.
customer_reviews.text: My child loves these and they have been extremely durable. I have a pair of my own and love them so we bought him a pair. They have not torn up anywhere. He wears them to play, to town, in the lake, everywhere. They are easy to get on and remove. He is three and puts them on himself. The do make his feet a little smelly sometimes but the shoe is machine washable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves these shoes! They run a bit large. His foot measured a little kids 12 so we ordered one size up to a 13. We had to return them for a 12 as the 13's were too big. The size 12 we ordered still had plenty of room for growth. They are well made and very comfortable. I highly would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Lindylu

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't possibly love these more than I already do
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't possibly love these more than I already do! They've been spectacular for my very active 4yo girl. Dancing, jumping, climbing trees, hiking, bouldering, sandbox play, etc. I guess it would be nice if the foot hole were a bit bigger for when kiddo is putting it on, but honestly my 4yo can handle it on her own so it's not a problem- just an additional minute or two getting ready to leave the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly toxic chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: Strong toxic chemical smell, these are not appropriate for children, not sure if the smell is coming from the adhesive or the paint on the rubber insoles and or soles but it is very strong and smells toxic
customer_reviews.author: Tatia

customer_reviews.title: Velcro wears out fast
customer_reviews.text: I love keens as an adult. I have multiple pairs as well as my husband. We got these for our two boys and they have worn them around a dozen times. The Velcro on the top strap has already stopped holding together.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I love the Velcro latch at the ankle
customer_reviews.text: Fits true to size. I love the Velcro latch at the ankle, keeps my 4yr old's shoes on and he's an extreme busy body! Quick and easy to put on and go! He also loves the colors. I also love that they're closed toe, so I don't have to worry about him hurting his toes while playing. We have gotten these wet a couple times at the beach and from our pool, and they dried quickly and still look brand-new. Very impressed by these. I would compare them to our oldest sons more expensive Merrell's in a similar style.
customer_reviews.author: Pndabby90

customer_reviews.title: Shoe has a problem, will try to exchange with Keen
customer_reviews.text: Grand-daughter loves these. But there's a durability problem. Will ask Keen to replace and report back on my customer service experience. Update - Keen has asked for photos and details about the shoe. Will decide in 7-10 days.
customer_reviews.author: dve

customer_reviews.title: Best summer sandal
customer_reviews.text: The best summer shoes for kids! Hybrid of a sneaker and a sandal that can be machine washed when they get too dirty or stinky. Great for a young walker, too, as they are very sturdy but flex with movement. We have tried several models of Keen sandals for our children and prefer the Seacamp model because it has more flexibility in the sole than other models, particularly the H2.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and cute
customer_reviews.text: We love these sandals and have purchased them two years in a row. My daughter is rough on her shoes and usually goes through three pairs of sandals in a summer. These lasted a summer and a half. She loves that they can get wet and dry quickly. No blisters after two full days walking around Disney World.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: No blisters first time wear
customer_reviews.text: My son is infamous for getting blisters from new shoes, all kinds, so we were pleasantly surprised when he didn't get any after wearing these! He's used them kayaking, hiking and general wear, comfortable and happy.
customer_reviews.author: jmatcd

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. My 5-year-old son is really rough on ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. My 5-year-old son is really rough on his shoes. He usually goes through a 2 pairs of sneakers in each size. We bought him a pair of knock-off brand waterproof sandals and they lasted a total of three weeks before completely falling apart. These are still going strong after a month with no signs of wearing out, even though he has worn them through mud puddles, streams, playgrounds, and spray parks. That is truly an accomplishment.
customer_reviews.author: marinimom

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not Keen's best
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE Keen shoes! They are fabulous for summer fun and provide great support. For some reason, this kind (Seacamp) and my toddler were not the perfect match. They weren't as comfy for her as the Newport. I'm going to switch to the Newport for next summer. Also, I feel like I need to give a warning. If your child has feet that sweat profusely, this may not be the shoe for you. It can really create a smelly situation.
customer_reviews.author: The Therapy Mama

customer_reviews.title: Flexible, lightweight, sensory-accepted
customer_reviews.text: I tried so many different sandals for my son who is very sensitive about the feel of his footwear. We tried sandals by oshkosh, merrell, pediped (2 different models), and kamik (2 different models) -- all were immediately rejected. These keens, however, are nice and flexible and extremely lightweight. I wouldn't recommend them for strenuous activity because of this. But my little guy (who has a very high top-of-foot, I might add) loves them. Finally!
customer_reviews.author: KD

product_meta.title: KEEN Kids' Seacamp II CNX-C
product_meta.description: From beaches to mountains to city streets, Keen believes the outdoors is anyplace without a ceiling. Keen believes in living a HybridLife, which means being part of a greater community that is full of people who create possibilities, play in the outdoors and care for the world around them.
feature_bullets: Secure fit lace capture system with hook and loop adjustability over instep
Metatomical molded ethylene vinyl acetate footbed
